meetings.name: Board of Trustees Meeting Notice
meetings.attachments: No associated attachments
meetings.agenda:
NOTICE OF THE REGULAR MEETING OF 
SUCCESS Academy BOARD OF TRUSTEES

PUBLIC NOTICE is hereby given that the Board of Trustees of SUCCESS Academy will hold an online meeting on the Google Meet platform. The online address for this meeting is meet.google.com/dca-rqic-iyp. Please call 435-592-9201 for assistance in logging on if needed. The meeting will commence at 4:00 pm on Monday, April 26th, 2021. 

The agenda for this meeting consists of the following:
 
Conducting: Dr. Michael LaCourse

Welcome:

A.   Approval of Minutes 
1. Minutes from March 31st, 2021 meeting
2. Minutes from February 22nd, 2021 meeting

B.   Public Input
		
C.   How well are school finances being managed and safeguarded from risk? 
	1. Review of Revenue and Expenditure Reports (John)
		a. Check Register
		b. Percent Updates

D.   How well is the school meeting federal, state, and USOE laws and regulations?
	1. Approval of 2021-2022 Board of Trustee Meeting Dates (Board Vote)
	2. Approval of 2021-20222 School Calendar for SUU, & DSU (Board Vote)
3. Approval of Fee Waiver (Fee Waiver Rules)for (SUU & DSU) and Spend Plan for 2021-2022 school 
year (Board Vote)
4. Trustland Plan (SUU, DSU)

E.   Executive Session
1. Executive session to discuss the purchase, exchange, or lease of real estate property.

	

Next Meeting-Monday, June 21st, 2021, 4:00 pm, SUU SUCCESS, Multipurpose Building, rm 210. The meeting will also be broadcast to the DSU SUCCESS Innovation Plaza Office.

 _____________________________________
John Tripp, Executive Director
meetings.electronicParticipation: Members of the Board may participate electronically.

NOTICE OF THE REGULAR MEETING OF THE
BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF SUCCESS ACADEMY
 
PUBLIC NOTICE is hereby given that the Board of Trustees of SUCCESS Academy will hold a regular meeting at the SUCCESS Academy ACE campus in the Innovation Plaza Building, Saint George, Utah, commencing at 4:00 pm on Monday, February 22nd, 2021. 

The agenda for this meeting consists of the 
following:

Conducting: Dr. Michael LaCourse 


A.   Approval of Minutes (October)

1. Minutes for November 10th, 2020

2. Minutes for October 26th, 2020



B.   Public Input

1. Science Fair reports (SUU and DSU)


C.   Finance 

1. Audit Results (James Gilbert)

2. Review of Expenditures and Revenue (John)

3. Board Member Mandatory Audit Training Requirements (John)

Module 1 Script  Module 1 youtube link

Module 2 Script  Module 2 youtube link

4. School Fee Approval for 2021-2022 (Tammy, J-Anne, Allison)

		SUU Fee Schedule

		DSU Fee Schedule

		ACE Fee Schedule

	  	

D.   Board Approval and Information

1. Enrollment and Lottery Results (Ben, Brian, Colin)

2. School Land Trust Reports and Updates SUU  DSU   (Brian and Ben)

3. Night of Excellence Assignments and Dates (Tammy, J-Anne, Allison)


E.   Executive Session

1. Executive session to discuss the purchase, exchange, or lease of real property.

meetings.agenda:
APRIL GOVERNING BOARD MEETING AGENDA
Utah Charter Academies
April 27, 2021
 
Notice is hereby given that the monthly meeting of the Board of Directors of Utah Charter Academies will be held on Tuesday, April 27, 2021 at 7:00 P.M. at American Preparatory Schools District Office located at 12894 S. Pony Express Rd. Unit 600, Draper, UT, 84020, or electronically at https://meet.google.com/jma-kwro-ono.

        CALL TO ORDER - 5 minutes
    
Welcome

PRESENTATIONS AND COMMENTS - 10 minutes

Public Comment
Board Training - None  

CONSENT AGENDA  -  5 minutes  *Consent agenda items are items that do not require discussion.  If any of the below require discussion, a motion may be made to move the item from the consent agenda.

	Requested motion: To approve the April 27, 2021 Consent Agenda
Minutes from March 23rd
APA Policies - Chapter C - Human Resources Policies
Ratification of March 23, 2021, board meeting motions

BOARD BUSINESS - 45 minutes

LEA-specific license requests - Jen Walstad (https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1D09pftsHnOikKqXpB1tAooa-jeZ0aUuYTFFiI3Rc-oE/edit?usp=sharing)
Requested motion: To approve the LEA-specific license requests that were presented

Procurement Policy (New Policy) - Kate York
Requested motion: To approve the APA Procurement Policy.
Brand Purchasing Policy (New Policy) - Kate York
Requested motion: To approve the APA Brand Purchasing Policy.

TSSA Framework - Changes for approval - Lisa Brunson
Requested motion:  To approve the TSSA campus distribution methodology added to APA's TSSA Framework.
APA's Charter Agreement - Proposed Changes - Lisa Brunson
Requested motion:  To approve the submittal of the proposed changes to APA's Charter Agreement to the State Charter School Board on behalf of UCA.

APA COVID Plan Proposal 04-27-2021 - For discussion and possible action

Human Sexuality Curriculum - Begin review for May Board Meeting approval 
7th grade Curriculum (no changes since previously approved)
10th grade Curriculum (no changes since previously approved)

  MANAGEMENT COMPANY REPORT - 60 minutes

Farewell to Connie Sims (Director of HR)
Academic Report (Carolyn Sharette)
Campus Reports
On/Off Campus Enrollment Data; Staff COVID Report (Daniel Baker)
2021-22 Enrollment Update
Financial Report (Casey Crellin)
FY20 Audit Update
Operations report (Tim Evancich)
Compliance Report (Lisa Brunson)
USBE CTE Corrective Action Plan 
Special Education Corrective Action Plan - Carolyn Sharette
Special Education Audit Appeal Response - Carolyn Sharette
Cedar City Expansion Update

EXECUTIVE SESSION TO DISCUSS PENDING LITIGATION

AGENDA ITEMS FOR FUTURE MEETINGS - 5 minutes

Next Meeting
May 25, 2021 @ 7pm

ADJOURNMENT

Pony Express Rd. Unit 600, Draper, UT, 84020, or electronically at https://meet.google.com/jma-kwro-ono.

        CALL TO ORDER - 5 minutes
    
Welcome

PRESENTATIONS AND COMMENTS - 15 minutes

Public Comment
Board Training - None

CONSENT AGENDA - 0 minutes

None

BOARD BUSINESS -  15 minutes

COVID Plan update
Suggested motion: To approve the COVID plan update

AGENDA ITEMS FOR FUTURE MEETINGS - 5 minutes

Next Meeting
December  15th, 2020

ADJOURN TO EXECUTIVE SESSION to discuss pending litigation
ADJOURNMENT

ATHENIAN eACADEMY
NOTICE / BOARD AGENDA 
Tuesday, April 20, 2021
TIME: 4:00 pm to 4:30 pm, or until done.
At the Above Location
(To call in See Page 3)

1.   Welcome											Board Chair

2.   Announcement - 								Board Chair / Jared Ferguson

Progress Monitoring Meeting with the State Turnaround meeting will be held on April 22nd. On May 6th, a Board member will meet with the State Board for a 10-minute presentation on our turn-around progress. 

This meeting is held primarily for Public Comments on the Fee / Fine Schedule and Fee Waiver Procedures for the 21-22 School Year. 

The Board will meet Tuesday April 27 to discuss & finalize the fees, fines and fee waiver presented for discussion in this & the March 23rd public meeting. Your input is appreciated.	
   

3.   Call to Order	 										Board Chair

4.   Roll Call											Board Secretary
	Quorum Present

5.   Public Comment 

The School Fee/Fine Schedule & Waiver Procedures for the 21-22 School Year are now open for Public Comment. Public Comments will close at 4:30, if all Public Comments have been made. Otherwise we will continue until all have had an opportunity to make comments.	If your comments are the same as previous comments made please be brief. 

Please state your name for the record. Comments are limited to 3 minutes per each person.
	
6.   Approval of any prior Minutes and Treasurers Report will be carried
 over to the next Regular Board Meeting April 27th 				Board Chair

ATHENIAN e ACADEMY
NOTICE / BOARD AGENDA
Tuesday, February 23, 2021
TIME: 4:00 pm to 6:00 pm
At the Above Location
(To call in See Page 3)
1. Welcome Ron Bateman
2. Announcements Ron Bateman / Jared Ferguson
3. Call to Order Ron Bateman
4. Roll Call Carol Andersen
Quorum Present
5. Public Comment, if any (Comments limited to 3 minutes)
6. Approval of January 19, 2021 Minutes. * Carol Andersen.
7. Treasurer's Report / Financial Statements. Karen Ellingson/Rebecca Strait
Purchase Report - Margo Walker
8. Academics - Jared Ferguson
COVID 19 Update Report
Report on Catapult Training February 16th and 17th
9. Governance - Ron Bateman
The Bylaws of Athenian eAcademy do not use the correct corporate name.
The name used is 'Athenian Academy' and should be Athenian eAcademy.
Authorize amending the Bylaws to 'Athenian eAcademy' *
10. Report on Lease Purchase Work - Q&A - Joel Wright
Board has previously received the Appraisal.
The purchase option has expired, but Landlord has agreed to again offer it.
The price offered is in the signed lease - cost plus 20% or $5,783,124.32.
No loan has been obtained; the USDA has been approached for a loan.
The Loan offer from the USDA will likely take 2 to 4 months to secure,
and would then come back to the Board for approval. The Board is not required to accept the USDA loan.
11. Establish Lease Purchase Committee - Ron Bateman
Board members - volunteer - provide the Board at the next meeting,
recommendations for legal counsel, budget, and a timeline.
New legal counsel proposed, cost.
A new Appraisal firm, cost.
Lease contract termination options.
Negotiation strategy to obtain a lower purchase price. Identify risks, likelihood of success, and costs.

Roll Call.

Return to Public Session - (begin recording) Report / Motions, if any. Ron Bateman

meetings.agenda:
BOARD MEETING AGENDA

Date:  Thursday, January 28, 2021			
Time: 4:00 pm 
Location: 3005 South 2900 East SLC, UT  84109

Board Members:  Becky Benham, Kristen Billeter, Robert Booth, Nicole Handy, David Hillyard, Justin Scott, & Kim Winterton. 

MISSION STATEMENT: Cultivate a school environment centered on the maximum academic, social, and emotional potential for each student.

AGENDA
	
1	Public Comment 		
2	Approval of Minutes from December 9, 2020	
3	PTO Report	
4	Review and approval of Field Trip Policy and Investment Policy	
5	Principal Report
-	Approval of LEA-Specific License Policy 	
6	Land Trust Funds	
7	Business Report	
8	Employment contract for future principal	
9	Governance	
10	Closed Meeting - Utah Code 52-4-205		


A public comment period for parents, employees, or visitors wishing to voice a concern or provide feedback are welcome to do so at the beginning of the Board meeting. Requests must be submitted in writing to Nicole Handy, Board Secretary, 24 hours in advance of the meeting via email at nhandy@canyonrimacademy.org. Generally, no more than 3 minutes each will be allocated.

CHANNING HALL SCHOOL  
  Board Meeting Agenda
Monday, April 19, 2021
REGULAR SESSION 5:30- 7:50 PM

Meeting Location: Channing Hall Gymnasium
13515 S. 150 E., Draper, UT 84020
Roles:
Meeting Leader: David Hunt
Time Keeper: David Hunt

TIME	TIMING	TOPIC	OWNER	OUTCOME
5:30	5 mins	Welcome and Announcements 

	David Hunt	Welcome
5:35	5 mins	-	Approve agenda.  
-	Approve minutes from 3/15/21 meeting.
-	Next meeting date:  Monday, May 17, 2021, 5:30 pm

	David Hunt	Approve
5:40	5 mins	Public comment

	David Hunt	Discussion
5:45	20 mins	Executive Committee - 
-	Approve proposed HoS Contract (closed session)
-	Send out Board survey in preparation for Board retreat
-	Schedule second interview with Board candidate Lisa Bruns

	David Hunt	Update

6:05	20 mins	Administrative Report
-	Review School Learning and Nurturing Development (LAND) Trust program report
-	Review mid-year updates to Strategic Plan (School performance and progress)
-	Lottery/Enrollment Update
-	Hiring/returning teacher update

**Possible Motion to approve School Learning and Nurturing Development (LAND) Trust program Plan
	Diane Wirth	Update

6:25
	25 mins	Policy Committee - Committee Report 
-	OE-14 Neutrality
-	OE-15 Long distance / overnight travel
-	OE-16 Check Signing Policy
-	Brian Carpenter 10 - Annual Check-Ups: Not just for physicals
	Colby Whitney	Update
6:50	15 mins	Finance Committee - Committee Report
-	Review Federal and School (General) Financial Policies
**Possible Motion to approve Federal and School (General) Financial Policies
	Amy Reams	Update
7:05	10 mins	PR Committee - Committee Report
-	Follow-up on marquee	Marcy Allen/Lacy Sylvia	Update
7:30	20 mins	**Possible Closed Session for the purpose of discussing the character professional competence or physical or mental health of an individual. Per UCA 52-4-205**
**Possible Motion to return to open meeting
Move back to open session

**Possible Motion to approve the Head of School's contract	
David Hunt	
7:50		Adjourn
		Motion

Vision & Mission Statement
Vision Statement
At DMA, our vision is to awaken within each child their unique potential that will enable them to make a valuable contribution to society.
Mission Statement
The mission of Dixie Montessori Academy (DMA) is to provide a child- centered, individualized education founded upon the philosophy of Dr. Maria Montessori. DMA will foster a structured environment of freedom and discovery in which each child can reach his or her full academic, social, and personal potential. Graduates of DMA will demonstrate creative thinking, self-discipline, respect, and cooperation, and will build a solid foundation for future success.

Action Items | Chair Haendiges
Approval of Child Find Policy, Approval of Playground
School Land Trust
Adjourn

meetings.agenda:
Board of Directors Zoom Meeting Minutes
April 8th, 2021, 5:00pm - 1160 N 645 West, Washington, Utah

Agenda Item
Presenter
Questions to answer
Time
Board Meeting Call to Order
 Chair Haendiges 
Board Members in Attendance on Zoom: Jim Haendiges, Nancy Glover, Ana Eldridge, Jessi Cox,  Board Members Absent: Roy Johnson
Others in Attendance on Zoom:Director Chelsea Bergeron, Mariah Phares, Amber Bain, Trisha Poole 
5:00
Approve Minutes From Previous Meeting  
Chair Haendiges 
Motion: Jessi Cox motions to approve the minutes from last meeting.
Anna Eldridge Seconds
Collective vote: Aye
Minutes are approved


Public Comment 
Chair Haendiges
No Public Comment


Administrative Report 
Director Bergeron 
The school has been working hard on rebranding and has submitted the name change to the state for approval. 
The school is currently working on many projects that will go along with the rebranding and an upcoming Montessori Festival/ Open House is being planned to showcase those changes. The school will also be participating in the upcoming Kite Festival.
Montessori Mondays have restarted providing in house Montessori training for all staff that would like it. 
The state Rise testing will begin the last week of April for all students. The state will not hold score against schools instead they are collecting data on the learning loss from Covid 
The Title 1 audit was held and went well. All grants are up to date. 




Financial Report 
Director Bergeron 
Nate Adams from Red Apple was unable to attend the meeting. Director Bergeron provided a financial overview for the last month. The budget for the school year 2021-2022 is being finalized and will be submitted to the state by June. The school's main financial goal is to increase enrollment for the 2021-2022 school year.  


Committee Reports 


No Committee Reports 


Discussion Items 
Chair Haendiges 
Rachel Webb has resigned from the board after serving for 1 1/2 years thank you for your service. The board will be recruiting new members in the next month.
Board member policy is being written to clarify board term limits and responsibilities. 
The Board's evaluation of the Director will be done in May. 
From the Title 1 audit there is one policy that needs to be written. Director Bergeron is writing it and will submit it to the board at the next meeting.


Action Items 
Chair Haendiges 
Mariah Phares introduced the bid for the fencing that will go around the perimeter of the new playground along with  garbage bins gates to be fixed. 
Motion: Jessi Cox motions to approve the fencing bid that was presented to the board.
Nancy Glover seconds
Ayes: Jessi Cox, Nancy Glover Ana Eldridge 
Motion is passed
The bid for the Elevated Activities Room was presented to the board. 
Motion: Jessi Cox motions to approve the bid for the Elevated Activities  Room as presented to the board .
Ana Eldridge seconds
Ayes: Jessi Cox, Nancy Glover, Ana Eldridge 
Motion is passed 
Director Bergeron presented the proposed 2021-2022 school year calendar.
Motion: Jessi Cox motions to approve the calendar as presented to the board.
Ana Eldridge seconds
Ayes: Jessi Cox, Nancy Glover, Ana Eldridge 
Motion is passed


Adjournment 
Chair Haendiges
Motion: Ana Eldridge motions to adjourn the meeting.
Jessi Cox seconds
Collective vote ayes
Meeting is adjourned
6:05
Next Board Meeting 
Chair Haendiges 
May 12th, 2021

https://drive.google.com/file/d/15Qf2l67AGrjGGg50MfBJ7TMyyo6k_kMZ/view?usp=sharing

At DMA, our vision is to awaken within each child their unique potential that will enable them to make a valuable contribution to society.
Mission
The mission of Dixie Montessori Academy (DMA) is to provide a child-centered education founded upon the philosophy of Dr. Maria Montessori. DMA will foster a structured environment of freedom and discovery in which each child can reach his or her full academic, social, and personal potential. Graduates of DMA will demonstrate creative thinking, self-discipline, respect, and cooperation, and will build a solid foundation for future success.

meetings.agenda:
Board of Directors Zoom Meeting Minutes
March 18th, 2021, 5:00pm - 1160 N 645 West, Washington, Utah

Agenda Item
Presenter
Questions to answer
Time
Board Meeting Call to Order
 Chair Haendiges 
Board Members in Attendance on Zoom: Jim Haendiges, Nancy Glover, Ana Eldridge, Jessi Cox,  Rachel Webb
Board Members Absent: Roy Johnson
Others in Attendance on Zoom:Director Chelsea Bergeron, Mariah Phares, Nate Adams (Red Apple), Amber Bain

Approve Minutes From Previous Meeting  
Chair Haendiges 
Motion: Jessi Cox motions to approve the minutes. 
Anna Eldridge Seconds
Collective vote: Aye
Minutes are approved


Public Comment 
Chair Haendiges
No Public Comment


Discussion Items 
Chair Haendiges 
Board membership- Jessi Rowley has resigned after serving the board for 1 1/2 years. Thank you for your service.
Strategic Plan: Chair Haendiges presented his findings from the faculty focus group. The 3 top comments were about community in the school and with parents, a strong Montessori identity and leadership similar to a PTVO to get parents involved with certain tasks. 


Director's Report 
Director Bergeron 
 Mrs. Bain completed testing ELL students this past week.
The school had their TItle 1 compliance check with the state and it went great.
Director Bergeron held a zoom meeting with parents called Check in with Chelsea that was very informative.
This week an out of state Montessori Consultant observed classrooms.
The school is getting ready for end of year testing on the RISE portal. Testing will begin the last week of April. This year's testing will not affect the school standing with the state. The testing will primarily be used for data to pinpoint any earning loss due to Covid.
Strategic planning- the state was made aware of the school's plan to rebrand and of using an estimate of $300,000 from savings towards this. 


Financial Report 
Nate Adams
Red Apple 
The school's bottomline is currently in the black and preliminary budgets for next school will be started.  


Committee Reports 


No Committee Reports 


Action Items
Chair Haendiges 
Motion: Jessi Cox motions to vote on approving the Transgender policy as presented to the board.
Nancy Glover seconds
Ayes: Jessi Cox, Nancy Glover
Nays: Ana Eldridge
Abstentions: Rachel Webb
The motion is passed.
Motion: Jessi Cox motions to change the name of the school from Dixie Montessori Academy to Mountain View Montessori.
Ana Eldridge Seconds
Ayes: Ana Elddridge, Jessi Cox, Nancy Glover 
Abstentions: Rachel Webb
The motion is passed.
Motion: Jessi Cox motions to vote on not using a DBA.
Ana Eldridge Seconds
Ayes: Ana Eldridge, Jessi Cox, Nancy Glover
Abstentions: Rachel Webb
The motion is passed 
Motion: Jessi Cox votes to engage in the rebranding of the school.
Ana Eldridge Seconds
Ayes: Jessi Cox, Nancy Glover
Abstentions: Rachel Webb, Ana Eldridge 
The motion is passed. 


Adjournment 
Chair Haendiges
Motion: Ana Eldridge motions to adjourn.
Jessi Cox seconds
Aye: Nancy Glover. Ana Eldridge, Rachel Webb, Joleen Rowley, Jessi Cox, 
Meeting is adjourned
7:05
Next Board Meeting 
Chair Haendiges 
   April 8th, 2021  5pm presented on Zoom.





Audio link: 
https://drive.google.com/file/d/18CpEH34QJoCQEAK99cUmVLExsH80EhXV/view?usp=sharing


Vision
At DMA, our vision is to awaken within each child their unique potential that will enable them to make a valuable contribution to society.
Mission
The mission of Dixie Montessori Academy (DMA) is to provide a child-centered education founded upon the philosophy of Dr. Maria Montessori. DMA will foster a structured environment of freedom and discovery in which each child can reach his or her full academic, social, and personal potential. Graduates of DMA will demonstrate creative thinking, self-discipline, respect, and cooperation, and will build a solid foundation for future success.

meetings.agenda:
Board of Directors Zoom Meeting Minutes
 February 11th,  2021, 5:00pm - 1160 N 645 West, Washington, Utah

Agenda Item
Presenter
Questions to answer
Time
Board Meeting Call to Order
 Chair Haendiges 
Board Members in Attendance on Zoom: Jim Haendiges, Nancy Glover, Ana Eldridge, Joleen Rowely, Jessi Cox, Roy Johnson, Rachel Webb
Others in Attendance on Zoom:Director Chelsea Bergeron, Mariah Phares, Nate Adams, Heather King, Dennis Siisterra-Gonzales, Marie Steffensen State Charter School Board (SCSB), Andrew Vardas-Doane (SCBC), William Evans (SCSB) 
5:00
Approve Minutes From Previous Meeting  
Chair Haendiges 
Motion: Rachel Webb  motions to approve the minutes. 
Jessi Cox  Seconds
Collective vote: Aye
Minutes are approved


Public Comment 
Chair Haendiges
No Public Comment


Discussion Items 
Chair Haendiges 
Discussion on Strategic Plan Draft using the survey results from parents and staff. The Strategic Plan draft includes 4 strategies (holistic Montessori philosophy, school identity, communication and involvement with stakeholders and employee rete


Director's Report 
Director Bergeron 
 Director Bergeron presented an update on Covid, Academics, Grant process and IDEA Complaint


Financial Report 
Nate Adams
Red Apple 
The school's bottomline is currently in the black. State revenues have been trued-up. The goal with the budget is to continue to stay in the black and add more revenue to the budget. 


Committee Reports 
Ana Eldredge 
Campus Management and Technology Committee: The money from the fundraisers were used to purchase 5 additional picnic tables. These tables will allow for classes to take advantage of eating outside and also for teaching outside. 


Action Items
Jessi Cox
Jessi Cox presented the Complaint/ Grievance Policy and form. The goal was to have a policy in place for all stakeholders, staff and students to know the procedure and organizational structure for filing a complaint/grievance. This policy encourages informal action of complaint using Montessori philosophy. If informal action doesn't resolve then the policy includes formal actions with timelines.
The form that was presented will give the opportunity to be specific with complaint/grievance, a goal for desired outcomes, details of the policy and timelines for submitting.
The current No Action Policy will refer to this policy. 
Motion: Rachel Webb motions to vote on approving the Complaint/Grievance Policy.
Ana Eldredge seconds.
Voting by roll call: Ana Eldredge aye, Rachel Webb aye, Joleen Rowley aye, Nancy Glover aye, Jessi Cox aye and Roy Johnson aye.
The motion is passed. 
Motion:  Rachel Webb motions to vote on approving the Complaint/Grievance Form.
Ana Eldredge seconds
Collective Vote: Aye 
The motion is passed 
Jessi Cox presented the Suspension & Expulsion  Policy which will establish procedures for communication and timelines dealing withr suspensions, expulsions and mandatory expulsions. 
Motion: Jessi Cox minions to vote to approve the Suspension & Expulsion Policy.
Ana Eldredge Seconds
Voting by roll call: Rachel Webb aye, Jessi Cox aye, Ana Eldredge aye, Joleen Rowely aye, Nancy Glover aye and Roy Johnson Aye.
The motion is passed. 
Jessi Cox presented the Transgender Policy. The school currently follows State & Federal laws and guidelines for transgender students. The school does not currently have a transgender policy in its manual.
The policy presented uses the same language from George Washington Academy's policy. The policy includes definitions, procedures for facilities, classrooms, activities and anti-bullying. This policy will follow USBE, State and Federal policies.
Jessi Cox motions to vote on approving the Transgender Policy.
Nancy Glover Seconds
The previous motions were rescinded with Ana Eldredge motioning to table passing this policy until the next board meeting.
Joleen Rowley Seconds
Collective Voting:  Aye 
The motion is passed.
The Child FInd Improvement Policy will be tabled until the next board meeting. The policy is currently under USBE review.


Adjournment 
Chair Haendiges
Motion: Jessi Cox motions to adjourn.
Ana Eldridge seconds
Aye: Nancy Glover. Ana Eldridge, Rachel Webb, Joleen Rowley, Jessi Cox, Roy Johnson, Jim Haendiges.
Meeting is adjourned
7:05
Next Board Meeting 
Chair Haendiges 
    March 18th, 2021 5pm presented on Zoom.

The mission of Dixie Montessori Academy (DMA) is to provide a child-centered education founded upon the philosophy of Dr. Maria Montessori. DMA will foster a structured environment of freedom and discovery in which each child can reach his or her full academic, social, and personal potential. Graduates of DMA will demonstrate creative thinking, self-discipline, respect, and cooperation, and will build a solid foundation for future success.

Public Comment is time for the public to give input to the board but is not a discussion time. Comments are limited to 3

       Scale

       Discussion/Approval of At-risk student 
       definition as: At Risk of Academic Failure 
      definition: Students with chronic 
      absenteeism of 90% or less attendance 
      rate; students with issues of emotional or 
      social problems that affect school 
      performance; students reading below 
      grade level as measured by state reading 
      test data; students on free/reduced lunch; 
      students with behavioral issues; students 
      with limited English proficiency; and any 
      other issues that may affect student 
      performance.

meetings.agenda:
The Governing Board of Freedom Preparatory Academy
WILL HOLD A PUBLIC MEETING
IN THE SECONDARY SCHOOL CONFERENCE ROOM

March 25, 2021 12:00 PM
							
Board members may and will participate electronically with anchor location stated above.

The public may participate electronically by joining via Zoom at the following link
https://zoom.us/j/91215618537 or dial (669) 900-9128, Meeting ID: # 912 1561 8537, Passcode: 867122
Public comment will be limited to three (3) minutes. Please state your name for the minutes.


				PUBLIC COMMENT 



REGULAR AGENDA

1.	Approval of minutes from the January 28, 2021 Governing Board Meeting
2.	Approval of Expense Report
3.	Approval of 2021 2022 Fee Schedule
4.	Approval of 2021 2022 School Calendars
5.	Announce FPA4 Campus Principal
6.	Review and Amend Policy #42
7.	Discuss and Update School Growth Plan
8.	SGU Hotel Reimbursement Pricing
9.	The Governing Board may consider a motion for a Closed Meeting in accordance 
with The Utah Open and Public Meetings Act for purposes outlined in Utah Code*
10.	Adjourn
















*The Freedom Preparatory Academy Governing Board may consider a motion to close the meeting to hold a strategy session 
to discuss the purchase, sale, exchange, or lease of real property, and/or the character, professional competence, or physical 
or mental health of an individual in conformance with § 52-4-204 and 52-4-205 et. Seq., Utah Code Ann.
Board Goals 2020

a.	Student and Employee Success
i.	Ensure the development data-driven methods to understand student success. 
ii.	Contribute to improving lives through development of policies and practices

b.	Operational Efficiency
i.	Require school to operate in the black
ii.	Oversee Retaining and Enrolling Students
iii.	Quarterly Enrollment review
iv.	Regular Policy Review each Board Meeting
 
c.	Community Relations
i.	Be involved regularly in Parent and Student engagement activities
ii.	Evaluate PR quarterly 
iii.	Governing Board Members attend and assist fundraisers

d.	Specific Areas of Focus
i.	Define what makes Freedom different/unique
ii.	Support consistent culture across campuses

Board Goals 2020

a.	Student and Employee Success
i.	Ensure the development data-driven methods to understand student success. 
ii.	Contribute to improving lives through development of policies and practices

b.	Operational Efficiency
i.	Require school to operate in the black
ii.	Oversee Retaining and Enrolling Students
iii.	Quarterly Enrollment review
iv.	Regular Policy Review each Board Meeting
 
c.	Community Relations
i.	Be involved regularly in Parent and Student engagement activities
ii.	Evaluate PR quarterly 
iii.	Governing Board Members attend and assist fundraisers

d.	Specific Areas of Focus
i.	Define what makes Freedom different/unique
ii.	Support consistent culture across campuses

meetings.agenda:
The mission of Lakeview Academy is to develop Capable, Confident, and Contributing members of society through learning experiences that foster growth, creativity, and character development.

The purpose of the board, on behalf of the citizens of Utah, is to see to it that Lakeview Academy (1) achieves what it should according to the Lakeview Academy Charter and state laws and (2) avoids unacceptable actions and situations.

1.	Welcome and Roll Call (6:00 p.m.)

2.	Pledge of Allegiance

3.	Reports (6:05 p.m.)
a.	Director's Report
   i.	Lottery Report
b.	Board Member Reports
c.	Financial & Accounting Report Ending February 28, 2021
   i.	AIM Up Charter Scoreboard Ending February 28, 2021
   ii.	Balance Sheet Report Ending March 31, 2021
   iii.	Income Statement Report Ending March 31, 2021
   iv.	Check Register Report Ending February 28, 2021
   v.	Consolidated APR Program Report Ending February 28, 2021
   vi.	P-Card Purchase Reports Ending March10, 2021
   vii.	Aegis Quarterly Report Ending December 31, 2021

4.	Public Comment: The public may address any issue not related to items already on the agenda. Please state your name for the official minutes. Please state your name for the official minutes, and please be concise. (6:30 p.m.)

5.	Board Business

6.	Consent Agenda (6:30 p.m.)
a.	Minutes March 11, 2021
b.	Financial Reports Ending February 28, 2021

7.	Action Items (6:45 p.m.)
a.	COVID 19 Updates
b.	Benefits Committee
c.	Language Arts and Mathematics Ends Policy
d.	Science Arts and Technology Ends Policy
e.	Parent Satisfaction Ends Policy

8.	Closed Session
a.	A motion to enter a closed session in accordance with Utah Code 52-4-205 for the purpose of discussion of litigation matters, acquisition of real property, or authorized personnel issues. 
b.	Action, if any, from closed session. 

9.	Adjourn (8:00 p.m.)


Lakeview Academy Board Meeting
Public Comment and Pattern of Formality Guidelines
The following are guidelines that were taken from Robert's Rules of Order and modified to assist the Lakeview Academy.

Public Comment
1.	During the agenda under the Public Comment section, the public may address any issue not related to items already on the agenda.  Please state your name for the official minutes. Please be mindful of the length of the board meeting and limit your comments to two minutes.
2.	After an item has been introduced and debated by the board, the President will call for Public comment on that item only.  Each public attendee shall have the opportunity to speak two times on the same issue on the same day.  It shall proceed that everyone will be given their first opportunity to speak before anyone will be given their second opportunity.
3.	To maintain order, if someone from the public is out of order, the President will verbally counsel them by calling, 'point of order.'

Order of Debate
1.	The item will be introduced by the sponsor if the sponsor is not present then the President will assign someone to do the introduction.
2.	Members debate the item (unless no one wished to debate it).  Each member is allowed two separate opportunities to speak on the item.
3.	The President will then open the item up for Public Comment following the directions in public comment section 2.
4.	The item will then be opened up to the Board for additional debate if necessary.
5.	A member makes a motion by saying, 'I move that ' if it is long; it should be prepared in writing and given to the President or Secretary.  If no motion is made then the item dies, and no further debate will occur.  
6.	Another board member may amend the motion.  If the motion is amended the President asks is their any objection to adopting the amendment.  If no objection is made, the chair may declare the amendment adopted.  If even one member objects, however the amendment is subject to debate and vote like any other motion.
7.	If the motion is amended the President may open it up to further board comment if necessary.
8.	The President will then call the question and take a vote on the item.
9.	The President announces the vote.

Pattern of Formality
1.	The President should be addressed as Mister or Madam President as appropriate.
2.	Wait to be acknowledged verbally or with a nod before speaking by the President.
3.	Speak only to the President or though him/her.
4.	Avoid personalizing any issue; speak to the subject, not the person you disagree with.  An example of this would be if you believe something said to be untrue, you would say, I believe the member is mistaken instead of saying something was a lie.
5.	If anyone breeches Robert's Rules or for example speaks out of turn, it is called a point of order and will be corrected by the President or any other board member that catches it.  One would say, 'Point of Order' The President would acknowledge the person and they would say what breech occurred.  The President would then say 'the point of order is well taken' or in unfounded, 'the point of order is not well taken.

Questions Board Members Consider When Making Decisions
1.	How will the decision affect the school?
2.	How does this decision relate to our mission statement and philosophy?
3.	What's the potential for legal problems if I vote yes?  What if I vote no?
4.	Does this decision affect:
a.	The students and families we serve?  How?
b.	Lakeview Academy's staff?  How?
c.	The community?   How?
d.	The Board of Trustees itself?   How?
Is the impact on any of these groups negative?  If it is, will the decision benefit significantly more people than it will harm?
5.	Have we voted on this matter before?  If yes, why are we considering it again?  How have the conditions changes?
6.	Do I have all the information I need to make a sound decision?  What questions should I ask before making this decision?
7.	If someone asked me to justify why I made this decision, can I explain my decision?

   k.	Science Arts and Technology Ends Policy
   l.	Parent Satisfaction Ends Policy

9.	Closed Session
   a.	A motion to enter a closed session in accordance with Utah Code 52-4-205 for the purpose of discussion of litigation matters, acquisition of real property, or authorized personnel issues. 
   b.	Action, if any, from closed session. 

10.	Adjourn (9:30 p.m.)


Lakeview Academy Board Meeting
Public Comment and Pattern of Formality Guidelines

The following are guidelines that were taken from Robert's Rules of Order and modified to assist the Lakeview Academy.

Public Comment
1.	During the agenda under the Public Comment section, the public may address any issue not related to items already on the agenda.  Please state your name for the official minutes. Please be mindful of the length of the board meeting and limit your comments to two minutes.
2.	After an item has been introduced and debated by the board, the President will call for Public comment on that item only.  Each public attendee shall have the opportunity to speak two times on the same issue on the same day.  It shall proceed that everyone will be given their first opportunity to speak before anyone will be given their second opportunity.
3.	To maintain order, if someone from the public is out of order, the President will verbally counsel them by calling, 'point of order.'

Order of Debate
1.	The item will be introduced by the sponsor if the sponsor is not present then the President will assign someone to do the introduction.
2.	Members debate the item (unless no one wished to debate it).  Each member is allowed two separate opportunities to speak on the item.
3.	The President will then open the item up for Public Comment following the directions in public comment section 2.
4.	The item will then be opened up to the Board for additional debate if necessary.
5.	A member makes a motion by saying, 'I move that ' if it is long; it should be prepared in writing and given to the President or Secretary.  If no motion is made then the item dies, and no further debate will occur.  
6.	Another board member may amend the motion.  If the motion is amended the President asks is their any objection to adopting the amendment.  If no objection is made, the chair may declare the amendment adopted.  If even one member objects, however the amendment is subject to debate and vote like any other motion.
7.	If the motion is amended the President may open it up to further board comment if necessary.
8.	The President will then call the question and take a vote on the item.
9.	The President announces the vote.

Pattern of Formality
1.	The President should be addressed as Mister or Madam President as appropriate.
2.	Wait to be acknowledged verbally or with a nod before speaking by the President.
3.	Speak only to the President or though him/her.
4.	Avoid personalizing any issue; speak to the subject, not the person you disagree with.  An example of this would be if you believe something said to be untrue, you would say, I believe the member is mistaken instead of saying something was a lie.
5.	If anyone breeches Robert's Rules or for example speaks out of turn, it is called a point of order and will be corrected by the President or any other board member that catches it.  One would say, 'Point of Order' The President would acknowledge the person and they would say what breech occurred.  The President would then say 'the point of order is well taken' or in unfounded, 'the point of order is not well taken.

Questions Board Members Consider When Making Decisions
1.	How will the decision affect the school?
2.	How does this decision relate to our mission statement and philosophy?
3.	What's the potential for legal problems if I vote yes?  What if I vote no?
4.	Does this decision affect:
   a.	The students and families we serve?  How?
   b.	Lakeview Academy's staff?  How?
   c.	The community?   How?
   d.	The Board of Trustees itself?   How?
Is the impact on any of these groups negative?  If it is, will the decision benefit significantly more people than it will harm?
5.	Have we voted on this matter before?  If yes, why are we considering it again?  How have the conditions changes?
6.	Do I have all the information I need to make a sound decision?  What questions should I ask before making this decision?
7.	If someone asked me to justify why I made this decision, can I explain my decision?

Leadership Learning Academy 
Board Meeting Agenda
Monday, March 15, 2021
Place:  Layton Campus, 100 W 2675 N, Layton, UT 84041

NOTE:  It is possible that the LLA Board of Directors may be utilizing an electronic meeting component with one or more of their members.

Agenda

-102 - Academic Excellence Policy
-602 - Fundraising Policy

7:15	UPDATE TO BYLAWS (5 MIN)

7:20	KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATOR (KPI) DASHBOARD AND STAKEHOLDER REPORTS     
(15 MIN)

PART II - HOW WELL ARE STUDENTS DOING?
 
7:35	SCHOOL COMMUNITY COUNCIL (10 MIN)
-TSSA Funding Update

7:45	SCHOOL SAFETY REPORT (10 MIN)
-Update from School Counselors
-Update from COVID 19 Community Coordinator

7:55 	CAMPUS DEVELOPMENT (10 MIN)
-Campus Development Committee Update
-Reimbursement Resolution
-Bonding Timeline
-Sale of South Campus
-Signed Purchase Agreement

PART III - IS EVERYTHING OCCURRING APPROPRIATELY?

8:05	FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT (10 MIN)
-Proposed Budget Amendment
-Financial report
-Key state reports
-Purchases over $5,000

8:15	DIRECTOR'S REPORT (20 MIN)
-Accreditation 
-LEA Specific License Vote

8:20	PUBLIC COMMENT (5 MIN)

8:25	ACTION ITEMS & ASSIGNMENTS (5 MIN)
-Consent agenda
-South Campus
-North Campus

-Approve board minutes from October 8, 2020    

8:30	CLOSED MEETING:  To discuss character, professional competence, physical or mental health of an individual (employee or student), and any of the following topics, if necessary: strategy sessions to discuss the purchase, exchange, lease or sale of real property; collective bargaining; or pending litigation.


9:00	ADJOURN

meetings.attachments: Agenda 4.15.21.pdf Other Added: 2021/04/13 09:34 PM  DRAFT Minutes 4.15.21.pdf Other Added: 2021/04/16 06:08 AM
meetings.agenda:
Mountainville Academy     
                         Board Meeting Agenda   
                                  April 15, 2021

Notice is hereby given that the Mountainville Academy Board of Trustees will hold a Board Meeting and Executive Session at 195 S Main Street, Alpine, UT on Thursday, April 15th, 2021 at 7:00 p.m. 



BOARD MEETING 

1. WELCOME & CALL TO ORDER 
Reverent Remarks 
Pledge of Allegiance
2. PUBLIC COMMENT  
Public Comment is time for the public to give input to the board, but is not a discussion time.  Comments are limited to 1-2 minutes per individual.  Individuals wishing to make a longer presentation to the board may request placement on the agenda by contacting the board secretary or chairman.  Administrative items, those regarding the day-to-day operation of the school, may be referred to the school director for resolution.  Individuals who have previously met with the school director and still have concerns should feel free to participate in the public comment portion of the meeting.     
3.  BUSINESS MANAGER'S REPORT 
4. CONSENT AGENDA 
Minutes 3.18.21

5.  DISCUSSION ITEMS
Board Training
Governing Board Training for School LAND Trust Program
Director's Report
Committee Reports
Executive
Academic Excellence
Finance
Development
Governance
Technology
FSO Report
School Fee Schedule 2021-2022
School Property Improvements
Other
      

6. ACTION ITEMS
School Fee Schedule 2021-2022
School Property Improvements
2021-2022 School Lands Trust



7. CLOSED/EXECUTIVE SESSION:  The Board will consider a motion to close the meeting to hold a strategy session to discuss pending or reasonably imminent litigation, and/or to discuss the purchase, exchange, or lease of real property, and/or the character, professional competence, or physical or mental health of an individual in conformance with 52-4-204 and 52-4-205 et. seq., Utah Code Ann.


8. Action items from Executive Session

9. ADJOURN 

The public is welcome to attend Mountainville Academy Board Meetings.  In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, those needing special assistance or accommodations should contact the secretary at khansen@malions.org, giving at least one working day notice.
meetings.electronicParticipation: No electronic or telephone participation is available for this meeting.

meetings.attachments: No associated attachments
meetings.agenda:
6:00 p.m.: Welcome (Brandy Barnett)
--Roll Call
--Invocation
--Pledge of Allegiance

6:02 p.m.: Consent Agenda (Items needing no discussion at this meeting. If there is an item listed here a board member wants discussed in the meeting, they vote against approving this consent agenda and that item will be put elsewhere on the meeting.) (Brandy)
--Approve this agenda--April 22, 2021
--Minutes approval--March 25, 2021
----Approve

6:06 p.m.: Presentation and comments (Public)
--Open Microphone (Open time for the public to give input to the board, but is not a discussion time.  Please limit comments to 3 minutes.  Individuals wishing to make a longer presentation to the board may request placement on the agenda by contacting the board secretary or chairman.  Administrative items, those regarding the day-to-day operation of the school, may be referred to the school director for resolution.  Individuals who have previously met with the school director and still have concerns should feel free to participate in the open microphone portion of the meeting.  The time allotted for public comment may be shortened if there are no or few persons present to comment.)
--If you would like to share during this time, please email Brandy Barnett at bbarnett@mynwa.us. She will share your comments during this time.

6:10 p.m.: Discussion and action item review (Brandy)
--Action item review, report, and follow-up
----Discuss
----Adjust as needed

6:15 p.m.: Special Education Policy and Procedure Manual (Angie Ashbaker)
--Approve manual
--Special Education Update
----Approve

6:25 p.m.: Board Members (Brandy)
--Discuss outgoing board members, need for new board members, and extending board member terms.
--Next month's meeting
----Approve as needed

6:35 p.m.: Committee Updates
--How is your committee supporting our goals for 2020-21? (Goal 1: By the end of the 2020-21 school year, we will maintain a waitlist in Kindergarten and first grade. This will be measured by parents coming in for a tour and registering. Goal 2: By the end of the 2020-21 school year, we will maintain a waitlist in 4 grades. This will be measured by the number of scholars on the waitlist. Goal 3: By December 2020, we will approve our new board policy manual. This will be measured by monthly assigned pages read before December. [COMPLETED])
--Academic Excellence (Nana Sono-Koree)
--Finance (Scott Allen)
--Building (Jon Jensen)
--Marketing (Jim Meyer)
--Parent Organization/Culture (Rosanne Robertson)
--Governance (Laticia)
--School Land Trust (Angie)
----Discuss
----Approve as needed

7:00 p.m.: Director Report (Angie)
--Enrollment update
--Staff update-salary adjustments
--Ability Goup discussion
--Update on the school 
----Discuss
----Approve

7:25 p.m.:  Closing (Brandy)
--Based on today's meeting, do we need to update any NWA documents (bylaws, charter, policy manual, etc.)?
--Agenda items for future meetings
--Review tonight's action items
--Next meeting May 27, 2021

7:00 p.m.: Adjourn to closed session (as needed) (Brandy)  
--Closed session to discuss property, personnel, and/or legal matters that are properly the subject of closed meetings.

7:00  p.m.: Adjournment
--(May be adjourned sooner, pending the coverage of agenda items.)

Odyssey Charter School
Governing Board Agenda-April 1, 2021
Board members:
Chair- Chuck Wood
Treasurer-Aaron Goodrich
Secretary-Melanie Castillo
Members-Megan Carpenter, Trevor Thurgood, Corban White

amend Agenda Aaron Goodrich move Corban White second//unanimous

Director's report: We did receive our PPP loan and will start using it on Monday when we do our first payroll since. We haven't had any students or staff out for the last 2 weeks with covid. All staff who wanted to receive the vaccine will receive them by the end of the month. Even though the mask mandate for the state ends in April, K-12 schools are still required to have them worn until June. Enrollment: we have seen a lot of facebook traffic and views of our virtual tours. We are sending out flyers to the new buildings around us. Looking to next year our budget is estimated on conservative enrollment numbers so it may affect our staffing situation. Aaron Goodrich move Corban White second//unanimous

Review and approve proposed Fee Schedule for 2021-2022 (add the fee policy to next agenda) Aaron Goodrich move Corban White second//unanimous

EL #1: Global Executive Limitations Policy Interpretation: Aaron Goodrich move Corban White second//unanimous, Assertion of Non-compliance: discussion on getting a teacher licensed in another state licensed here. meetings.attachments: OCS Board Meeting 03.30.2021.mp3 Audio Recording Added: 2021/04/14 09:56 AM
meetings.agenda:
Odyssey Charter School
Governing Board Agenda-March 30, 2021
Board members:
Chair- Chuck Wood
Treasurer-Aaron Goodrich
Secretary-Melanie Castillo
Members-Megan Carpenter, Trevor Thurgood, Corban White 

Welcome/ call to order:
approve Agenda Corban White moved Trevor Thurgood second unanimous
Public comment
Please limit comments to 5 minutes. The board may comment on issues raised during this period, but State law does not allow the board to take final action on issues raised during this time unless they are already on the agenda for a vote (USC-52-4-202 6c). 
Business (20 minutes)
Discuss Proposed Fee Schedule for 2021-2022: We don't charge fees for activities during school like lockers and such. We only charge for extra curricular activities. Next year we will not be able to charge textbook fees. The fees that we receive for activities go directly back into the program for which they were received. Anything leftover can go into the school general fund. Our policy comes pretty much from the outline from the state as does our waiver. Mr. Schellhous is the fee administrator. 
Noted that the fee schedule has been reviewed for the first time. 

Adjourn

meetings.agenda:
Odyssey Charter School
Governing Board Agenda-February 11, 2021
Board members:
Chair- Chuck Wood
Treasurer-Aaron Goodrich
Secretary-Melanie Castillo
Members-Megan Carpenter, Trevor Thurgood, Corban White (absent)

Welcome/ call to order:
approve Agenda Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, unanimous
approve minutes from the January 12, 2021 Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, unanimous
Public comment
Please limit comments to 5 minutes. The board may comment on issues raised during this period, but State law does not allow the board to take final action on issues raised during this time unless they are already on the agenda for a vote (USC-52-4-202 6c). 
School performance (15 minutes)
Director's report: meeting with the state charter school board on Monday, there are new staff that are portfolio managers to help keep schools accountable and help be a resource so there are less corrective actions needed. Robert is ours. They discussed a lot about the open and public meeting act and we need to make sure we are posting our schedule for the year on the website make sure that we are being compliant. PPP could help us financially. Discussion on pros and cons of applying for PPP  **Chuck Wood entered** New second grade teacher (Ms. Lunz) started in January and so far things seem to be going well. Covid update: we are planning on applying for more funds and we plan to use that money to try to get closer to the 1:1 tech ratio. Most of our faculty have been vaccinated or have been working on getting things scheduled. Parent and teacher surveys have been sent out. Teachers are pretty evenly split on end time for next year. Administration recommends getting back to normal time. Data will be presented next time for the parent input. When asked what teachers would like to see changed, curriculum is one that is brought up frequently, specifically Saxon so that is something we are going to look at possibly changing. We are in the midst of collecting applications for the board seat but we don't have any applications. It is for the seat that is currently vacant. Proof of payroll was presented. Acknowledge:Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, unanimous
Business (20 minutes)
Form 990 Review: Everyone has seen it and reviewed the document. 
Governance (30 minutes)
EL #2b: Treatment of Faculty and Staff, Interpretation: Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, unanimous//Assertion of compliance Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, unanimous
EL #2g: Compensation & Benefits Interpretation: Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, unanimous//Assertion of compliance Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, unanimous
GPP #3b 1-3: Board Job Description Assertion of compliance: Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, unanimous
GPP #4b: Board Job Description Assertion of compliance: Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, unanimous
BMD #2a: Unity of Control Assertion of compliance: Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, unanimous
Ends #3a 1, 6 Mission Specific Outcomes Interpretation:Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, unanimous//Assertion of noncompliance Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, Discussion: It isn't anticipated that the deficit will take too long to overcome. The school is prepared to teach in person or online at any given time. unanimous Interpretation: Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, unanimous//Assertion of compliance, Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, Discussion: Chuck Wood: this data doesn't neccessarily support the assertion. unanimous

Closed Session Move to closed session Trevor Thurgood, yay, Aaron Goodrich, yay, Megan Carpenter, yay, Chuck Wood, yay, Melanie Castillo, yay

Closed session in accordance with Utah code 52-4-205; (a) discussion of the character, professional competence, or physical or mental health of an individual; (b) strategy sessions to discuss collective bargaining; (c) strategy sessions to discuss pending or reasonably imminent litigation; (d) strategy sessions to discuss the purchase, exchange, or lease of real property; (e) strategy sessions to discuss the sale of real property. 

Motion to go back to open session. Trevor Thurgood move, Megan Carpenter second, Trevor Thurgood yay, Aaron Goodrich yay, Megan Carpenter yay, Melanie Castillo yay, Chuck Wood yay

Trevor Thurgood, Aaron Goodrich, Megan Carpenter, Chuck Wood, Melanie Castillo present. Starting next month Mr. Schellhous will be providing the program financial information

meetings.name: January 12, 2021 Board Meeting Minutes
meetings.attachments: OCS Board Meeting 01.12.21 #1.mp3 Audio Recording Added: 2021/01/14 09:27 AM  OCS Board Meeting 01.12.21 #2.mp3 Audio Recording Added: 2021/01/14 09:28 AM
meetings.agenda:
Odyssey Charter School
Governing Board Agenda January 12, 2021
Board members:
Chair Chuck Wood
Treasurer Aaron Goodrich
Secretary Melanie Castillo
Members Megan Carpenter, Trevor Thurgood, Corban White 

Welcome/ call to order:
approve Agenda Megan Carpenter moved Trevor Thurgood second, Aaron Goodrich moved to move closed session to beginning of the meeting, unanimous vote
approve minutes from the December 8, 2020 Meeting Megan Carpenter moved Trevor Thurgood second, unanimous vote
Public comment
Please limit comments to 5 minutes. The board may comment on issues raised during this period, but State law does not allow the board to take final action on issues raised during this time unless they are already on the agenda for a vote (USC-52-4-202 6c). 
School performance (15 minutes)
Directors report: Open enrollment is coming up and we already have some ITRs even though it hasn't opened yet. We are hopeful we will be able to go back to our regular schedule and not offering an online option.  Online has been difficult on students and teachers. We are still negotiating with the second grade teacher. We feel like she will fit in well with the culture of Odyssey and are encouraged by how well she is fitting what we would like to see. Ms. Bayless has to leave and we have made some adjustments to fill her void in the math department. We don't anticipate any other staff changes through the end of the year.  Covid update: we currently have no staff quarantined and we have 8 students on quarantine and none of them have tested positive. 3 come off tomorrow. 
**Aaron Goodrich had to leave**
Mr. Wood had questions about the attrition reports. Move to accept directors report:  Megan Carpenter moved Trevor Thurgood second, unanimous vote
Mr. Schellhous found information that Mr. Wood inquired about.
Business (20 minutes)
Change to Bylaws update-Chuck The changes we have applied for are to have no less than 5 and no more than 7 members and a quorum is a majority instead of a specific number. Also a change to when board elections are held. Provided updates are made for the election changes are we okay to have Chuck move forward with submitting these changes to the bylaws?  Megan Carpenter moved Trevor Thurgood second, unanimous vote
Discussion and approval of 2021-2022 school calendar Both options include same days off and are only off by one day. We like the idea of doing what is easiest for teachers and students. Motion to adopt the OCS Draft with the update to 9/23 and 2/17.  Megan Carpenter moved Trevor Thurgood second, unanimous vote
Governance (30 minutes)
EL #3f, 10: Asset Protection  Interpretation; Megan Carpenter moved Trevor Thurgood second, unanimous vote Assertion of compliance;  Megan Carpenter moved Trevor Thurgood second, unanimous vote
EL #3f, 11: Asset Protection Interpretation; Megan Carpenter moved Trevor Thurgood second Including areas that are not specifically covered in our school identity. How is that all represented in the community? Include school branding? Unanimous vote Assertion of compliance; Megan Carpenter moved Trevor Thurgood second, unanimous vote
GPP #5b, 1-5: Board Job Description Chair assertion of compliance; Megan Carpenter moved Trevor Thurgood second, unanimous vote 
BMD #1-Global BMD policy Chair assertion of noncompliance; Megan Carpenter moved Trevor Thurgood second, Corban White disagrees and claims we are not interfering. We make recommendations and then leave it up to Mr. Schellhous to make the ultimate decision. Chuck Wood would claim that we may not know where the line is between ends and means. Motion amended to accept the chair's assertion to one of compliance instead of noncompliance.  Interpretation; Trevor Thurgood  second unanimous vote
Ends #3a 10 Interpretation; Megan Carpenter moved Trevor Thurgood second, unanimous vote Assertion of compliance;  Megan Carpenter moved Trevor Thurgood second, unanimous vote

Closed Session 
Closed session in accordance with Utah code 52-4-205; (a) discussion of the character, professional competence, or physical or mental health of an individual; (b) strategy sessions to discuss collective bargaining; (c) strategy sessions to discuss pending or reasonably imminent litigation; (d) strategy sessions to discuss the purchase, exchange, or lease of real property; (e) strategy sessions to discuss the sale of real property.  Aaron Goodrich moved for roll call vote, Unanimous...Motion to form a committee to investigate possible lender options. Megan Carpenter moved Trevor Thurgood second, unanimous vote

Board Training: Financial Documents #1 (to minute 10:04)
Corban White, Melanie Castillo, Chuck Wood, Megan Carpenter, Trevor Thurgood
Next meeting: February 11, 2021 @ 6:30
Adjourn

III. Finance	4:38 PM
Finance
A.Financial Review
FYI	Spencer Adams	10 m
B.E-Rate Changes
Vote	Debbie Deem	5 m
Since we were able to upgrade our Access Points with the CARES grant, we have looked to shift our timeline for our E-rate grant.
We were originally planning on installing Ubiquity APs; however, they were unable to provide them to us in the time needed for the grant, so we went with Meraki APs. 
 
We are increasing our network capacity to 10 Gig; therefore, we want to upgrade our switches, Router and Firewall to match that capability in a quicker timeframe..
Since we installed Meraki APs, we would like to match the other materials to Meraki for better compatibility. The removal of the APs from the E-rate plan enables us to use Meraki for the same budget. The E-rate plan allows us to make this change as well. We are not changing vendors.
 
Recommended for Board vote: 
Approval of updated timeline with the installation of Meraki hardware. See attached sheet for the original timeline and the proposed timeline.
 FY 20 Erate Bid Information - Frubu Graphic overview.pdf
 FY 20 Erate Bid Information - Frubu Timeline old and new.pdf
 Meraki Network Narrative.pdf

C.Copy Machine Purchase
Vote	Debbie Deem	5 m
We have been leasing one of our copy machines in conjunction with paying off a previous unpaid service bill. The service debt and the lease are up in March. We propose the purchase of a replacement copy machine. 
Copy Machine: $12,248.00
Service Debt payoff: $1,943.37
Total: $14,191.37
(additional $594.43 to ship the old machine back to the warehouse)
 Ogden Prep Academy M905_.pdf

D.Garbage and Recycling Contract
Vote	Debbie Deem	5 m
The contract for Garbage and Recycling with Republic Services is up for renewal. We solicited bids from 4 companies for the service, see procurement paperwork attached. 
 
All bids are lower than the current rate we are paying. Ace Disposal has presented the lowest cost and confirmed no additional charges will be included. 
 
Disclaimer: Ace Disposal handles the garbage services for Debbie Deem's apartment business; however, there is no benefit to her or her business for choosing Ace Disposal. There is no additional association or relationship between Mrs. Deem and Ace Disposal.
 Garbage and Recycling Procurement information FY21.pdf

A.Administrative Board Report
Discuss	Kasey Kennington	20 m
 Administrative Board Report 01.14.2021.pdf
 FY21 Safety Review - Sheet1.pdf

B.Quarantine Policy review and potential edits.
Vote	Debbie Deem	10 m
1. Vaccine. Will the quarantine requirements be different for those who have received the vaccine?
2. Update to the State School Manual regarding quarantines:  No quarantine is necessary if it is verified that the person who is positive, and the person exposed both wore masks at time of exposure, and the exposed person does not have symptoms.
 COVID-19_School_Manual_Summary 12.17.2020.pdf

V. School Update	4:55 PM
A.Pandemic Related School Schedule
Vote	William Davis	10 m
As we prepare to move into second semester, we need to determine what the schedule will be.
Previously the Board approved the following for Semester 1:
Junior High: staggered attendance Monday through Thursday with remote learning on Friday.
Elementary: In person learning Monday through Thursday with remote learning on Friday.
Recommendation for Board Vote:
Originally  we were anticipating an improvement in the pandemic situation; however, due to the increase in COVID cases and quarantines, the Administration asks that the Board approve the continuation of the current school schedule through Semester 2. Although the schedule for in person students will remain the same, both buildings will work to allow online students to move to in-person by request. Should the pandemic situation improve, the schedule may be revisited. 
B.Quarantine Policy Discussion
Vote	Debbie Deem	10 m
The policy has been attached with redlines for Administrative suggested edits.
 
Discussion (The Administration has not made a determination on the following; any decisions made by the Board shall be reflected in the Policy update):
The CDC/Utah Health Department has recommended reducing the quarantine time for exposure from 14 days to 10 days. Attached is the data we have from the quarantined staff at school related to this timeline.
The CDC has stated that there is no need to quarantine 90 days after recovering from COVID. 
Travel related quarantines in conjunction with any changes to the 14 days or 90 day information.
Policy Management: Do we want to continue to make all changes dependent of Board vote, or do we want a caveat for change in relation to CDC or Health Department recommendations?
Websites related to this discussion:
Utah Coronavirus information page: https://coronavirus.utah.gov/protect-yourself/?fbclid=IwAR2zb4ds9QE9mEmVrDInUc7PquQypErq5x-CypDraEoanIsmWIvOiuuaR2Y
CDC: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/hcp/duration-isolation.html
Attachments:
Email from Weber-Morgan Health Department nurse assigned to OPA.
Data from survey to quarantined staff.
 6.27.POL COVID-19 Quarantine Policy - Google Docs.pdf
 FY21 12-2020 Staft Quarantine Survey - Sheet1.pdf
 Quarantine email from Public Health Nurse regarding quarantine time.pdf

Discuss	Kasey Kennington	20 m

to protect the privacy of an individual.

Vote	William Davis	5 m
VI. Policies	5:45 PM
A.Donation of Personal Time Off Policy
Vote	Debbie Deem	5 m
The policy restricted the amount of PTO that could be donated. Since donations are voluntary, we would like to increase that donation limit. Also, reasons to receive donations were limited to catastrophic illnesses, we would like to expand that to any event covered by FMLA.
 6.02.POL Donation of Personal Time Off Policy - Google Docs.pdf

meetings.agenda:
AGENDA
 
The Mission of Promontory School of Expeditionary Learning is to provide a rich educational environment that views learning as an Expedition and uses the study of Great Thinkers to cultivate the value of excellence and the love of knowledge. Using investigation and
discovery to make connections to ideas and our community, we empower children to embrace
challenge, act with humanity, and become the Great Thinkers of the 21st century.

meetings.agenda:
PUBLIC NOTICE
The Board of Trustees will meet in regular, work, and potential closed sessions on Thursday 5/6/2021 beginning at 4:00pm at the Providence Hall High School Library, 4557 W Patriot Ridge Dr, Herriman UT.

In accordance with directives regarding social distancing, the public may view the meeting online using the link below. https://us02web.zoom.us/j/83403593771?pwd=Tk5sNUw1YzJEaFhZSnhJQkZEK3Avdz09
Password if needed is 220749. 

AGENDA

I) GENERAL SESSION - OPEN MEETING
   A) Welcome, Call to Order & Roll Call
   B) Public Comment(s) - Those desiring to make public comments must email board@providencehall.com by one hour prior to the start time on the day of the meeting. Emails received outside this time will not be read. The email should include the name and the general location where the individual lives. Emails will be read in the order received. Emails will be read up to three minutes in length. In those situations where large groups of people desire to address the Board on the same subject, the Board requests that the group selects only one or two individuals to email the Board on behalf of the group and the email representing the group shall be allocated up to six minutes to be read. No more than 45 minutes will be allocated to public comments in a Board meeting. The public should be aware that the Board is unable, by law, to deliberate or take action on items raised during the public comment period. The Board will not take public comment on personnel issues or statements regarding the character, professional competence, and the physical or 
mental health of an individual during Board meetings.
   C) Reports
       1) Elementary School (Earleen Sutton, Kimberly Andersen, Doug Pinkal)
       2) Junior High School (Awbree Summers, Ally Turley, Brandon Hawkins)
       3) High School (Melissa McPhail, Neal Porter)
    D) Business Financial Report (Beverly Ledward)       
    E) Submitted Business Items
       1) Elementary School Personalized Learning Student Day May 28, 2021 (Earleen Sutton - Vote)
       2) Human Sexuality Instruction Instructional Assurances (Nate Marshall - Vote)
       3) Auditing Services (Nate Marshall & Beverly Ledward - Vote) 
       4) Landscape Equipment & Supplies Purchases (Nate Marshall, Beverly Ledward & Shannon Singleton - Vote)
       5) FY22 Budget Hearing (Beverly Ledward & Nate Marshall - Informational & Discussion) 
    F) General Business
       1) Set Next Meeting Day/Time (Board)
       2) Approval of 4/8/2021 Regular Meeting Minutes (Board - Vote)

II) WORK SESSION - OPEN MEETING
The Board may engage in discussion, provide administrative action, or take other action on any of the work session items listed below.
   A) Land Trust Plan
   B) Charter Exhibit A Review
   C) Elementary Addition Construction Project Update
   D) School Week for 21-22 School Year

III) POTENTIAL CLOSED SESSION (Board - Vote) - For the character, professional competence, or physical or mental health of individual(s), or for collective bargaining, or for pending or reasonably imminent litigations, or for purchase, exchange, or lease of real property
meetings.electronicParticipation: Electronic Participation is available upon request. Notice must be made in writing 48 hours before any public meeting. Electronic media includes telephone conference calls.

In accordance with directives regarding social distancing, the public may view the meeting online using the link below. https://us02web.zoom.us/j/85236211899?pwd=YUI1OUZWQ3lnYmozODIxVkRCeE5hdz09 - Password if needed is 279709.

I. GENERAL SESSION - OPEN MEETING - 4pm
A. Welcome, Call to Order & Roll Call
B. Public Comment(s) - Those desiring to make public comments must email providencehallboard@gmail.com by one hour prior to the start time on the day of the meeting. Emails received outside this time will not be read. The email should include the name and the general location where the individual lives. Emails will be read in the order received. Emails will be read up to three minutes in length. In those situations where large groups of people desire to address the Board on the same subject, the Board requests that the group selects only one or two individuals to email the Board on behalf of the group and the email representing the group shall be allocated up to six minutes to be read. No more than 45 minutes will be allocated to public comments in a Board meeting. The public should be aware that the Board is unable, by law, to deliberate or take action on items raised during the public comment period. The Board will not take public comment on personnel issues or statements regarding the character, professional competence, and the physical or mental health of an individual during Board meetings.
C. Reports
   1. Business/Financial (Beverly Ledward)
D. Submitted Business Items
   1. Junior High 21-22 Fee Schedule (JH Admin & Nate Marshall - Discussion)
   2. High School 21-22 Fee Schedule (HS Admin & Nate Marshall - Discussion)
   3. Employee Retention Credit (Shannon Singleton & Beverly Ledward- Vote)
E. General Business
   1. Set Next Meeting Day/Time (Board)
   2. Approval of  2/18/21  Regular Meeting & Work Session Minutes (Board - Vote)

II. POTENTIAL CLOSED SESSION - 5pm
A. Character, professional competence, or physical or mental health of individual(s)
B. Collective bargaining
C. Pending or reasonably imminent litigations
D. Purchase, exchange, or lease of real property

meetings.agenda:
The Board of Trustees will convene and conduct a Special Session  Meeting, with the option for the Board, school administrators, and district personnel to meet in-person and all others viewing the meeting electronically using the link below. 
https://us02web.zoom.us/j/85005536095?pwd=aGtMa0p5Z3pHVzFWbVhZcUg3am9NQT09
The password if needed is 952479. 

I. Welcome
II. Call to Order
III. Roll Call
IV. Public Comment(s)
Those desiring to make public comments must email providencehallboard@gmail.com by one hour prior to the start time on the day of the meeting. Emails received outside this time will not be read. The email should include the name and the general location where the individual lives. Emails will be read in the order received. Emails will be read up to three minutes in length. In those situations where large groups of people desire to address the Board on the same subject, the Board requests that the group selects only one or two individuals to email the Board on behalf of the group and the email representing the group shall be allocated up to six minutes to be read. No more than 45 minutes will be allocated to public comments in a Board meeting. The public should be aware that the Board is unable, by law, to deliberate or take action on items raised during the public comment period. The Board will not take public comment on personnel issues or statements regarding the character, professional competence, and the physical or mental health of an individual during Board meetings. 
V. Agenda Item(s)
    A. Term Extension for Board Chair, David Vaas (Vote Item), Background - USCSB is requiring the Board to vote to extend the 5-year Board Member term limit to a defined time period. The request has been submitted for a term extension for David Vaas to the end of the 2020-2021 Fiscal Year-ending June 30, 2021. Marie Steffensen with USCSB has received PHCS' request and it is marked as in process pending Board Approval. We will submit the minutes of this  meeting to her once as proof of Board vote on this item.
    B. Selection of Next Board Chair  (Vote Item), Background- As David Vaas' term comes to a conclusion, a strategic selection of the next Board Chair will be made to transition over the next 6 months.
VI. Adjourn Open Session
VII. Enter Closed Session for the Purpose(s) of the discussion of the character, professional competence, or physical or mental health of an individual. Please note that Closed Session may occur prior to Agenda Item B or before voting on Agenda Item B, and if so the Board will go into Closed Session then will reconvene Open Session to continue with/finish Agenda Item B.

None

COVID-19 Update by Susie Scherer
The director discussed the progress of the distribution of the vaccines.  

Review and vote on amending the 2021-22 school calendar to include noon dismissals every Friday

The director reviewed the survey sent to parents about noon dismissal.  The school will still be over the hour requirement. 

MOTION: A motion by Paul Jerome and a 2nd by Rachel Dabel to approve the amendment to the school calendar by adding noon dismissal each Friday passed unanimously via roll call.

Update on new HVAC installation

The new HVAC system was installed over spring break.


Review and vote on extending COVID hours through the end of the year

Since the last extension, the hours were used one time.  Our budget would not have to be adjusted to accommodate this change.

MOTION: A motion by Kedrick Morris and a 2nd by Michelle Bennett to approve extending the COVID hours through the end of May passed unanimously via roll call.

Meetings

The Board discussed updating the Cost of Governance policy to remove outdated budgets for training.

The Board discussed retiring the Delegation to the Director policy as it is covered by the Accountability of the Director executive policy.

The Board discussed modifying the Emergency Director Succession policy from requiring two successors trained to have staff trained to be familiar with all necessary functions of the school until a qualified replacement is found.

ACTION: The director will group these executive policies so that we can review them in their respective categories. 


Review Teacher Pay - Susie Scherer

ACTION: Preston will add a yearly agenda item in April to review teacher pay.

ACTION: Add teacher pay scale to our May Board Meeting.
